home.subHeading: Through rigorous clinical investigation and multidisciplinary collaboration, we aim to transform plant-based compounds into scientifically validated phytomedicines. Our work bridges traditional knowledge with modern biomedical research, delivering innovative, effective, and safe therapeutic solutions for global healthcare needs.

about.title: About
about.vision: To pioneer a transformative future in healthcare where plant-based medicines lead therapeutic innovation, fostering global wellness and environmental sustainability for generations.
about.mission: We are dedicated to advancing phytomedicines through the fusion of traditional botanical wisdom and modern scientific rigor. Committed to ethical sourcing and sustainable practices, we deliver safe, effective, and accessible natural therapies that enhance health outcomes while preserving our planet.

teamMembersPartOne.name: Datuk Dr. Mukundan Pillay
teamMembersPartOne.bio: Datuk Dr. Mukundan Pillay is a distinguished leader renowned for his transformative contributions to healthcare systems in Malaysia and globally. Over a 32-year career with the Malaysian Ministry of Health, he spearheaded critical initiatives in health infrastructure, policy, and research. Post-retirement, he extended his expertise to international organizations, including the World Bank in Bahrain and the World Health Organization (WHO) in China, while remaining actively engaged in advancing Malaysia’s healthcare landscape.

teamMembersPartOne.name: M. Paramesswaran
teamMembersPartOne.bio:
Public Health Advocate.

- Spearheaded community-based health initiatives for 15+ years, promoting plant-based wellness and preventive care as sustainable, accessible alternatives to conventional healthcare, reaching 500+ individuals annually through workshops, seminars, and one-on-one consultations.
- Collaborated with local NGOs, wellness centers, and holistic health practitioners to design culturally sensitive educational programs on phyto-based medicine, improving health literacy in underserved communities.
- Advocated for integrative health policies by partnering with regional public health coalitions, contributing research on phytotherapy’s role in chronic disease prevention to inform community health strategies.

teamMembersPartOne.name: Dr. Furizat
teamMembersPartOne.designation: Director of Product Innovation and Compliance
teamMembersPartOne.bio:
Dr. Furizat Yahya, PhD
N.D., D.H.D (AM), D.O.H.M. (AM), ABE (London)

Dr. Furizat Yahya is a pioneering figure in phytomedicine, recognized for integrating traditional wisdom with scientific validation. As Co-Founder & Chief Scientific Officer of Bio-Spectra and Secretary General of the Malaysia Association of Natural Medicine Practitioners (MANMP), she leads innovation in evidence-based plant therapeutics and advocates for regulatory advancement across Southeast Asia. Her work centers on clinical validation, ethical standards, and scalable models for natural healthcare solutions.

advisoryGroupPartOne.name: Dr. Parasuraman
advisoryGroupPartOne.designation: International Advisor on Sustainable Agriculture and Biodiversity Governance
advisoryGroupPartOne.bio:
Dr. N. Parasuraman is a distinguished scientist specializing in sustainable agriculture policy, biodiversity conservation, and rural development. He has held key leadership roles, including serving on the Planning Boards of Pondicherry and Periyar Universities and as a Senate Member for Bharathiar, Madras, and Bharathidasan Universities.

He has contributed to national policy as a member of the National Biodiversity Authority of India and the Tamil Nadu Government's 12th Five-Year Plan Committee. Internationally, he is a long-standing member of the International Water Resources Association and a Fellow of the Indian Academy of Social Sciences.

Dr. Parasuraman actively advises governments and institutions on agriculture, environment, and rural development, reinforcing his commitment to sustainable growth and youth empowerment. He is also affiliated with the Indian Science Congress Association, the Centre for Agriculture & Rural Development, and ICAR-NRC on Biotechnology.

advisoryGroupPartSecond.name: S. Sarvinnah Haran
advisoryGroupPartSecond.bio:
Sarvinnah is a passionate biomedical scientist with a Master of Science from Taylor's University, specializing in IFN-γ signalling and LAG-3 in non-small cell lung carcinoma. With experience in clinical microbiology, diagnostics, and cancer research, she currently serves as a Graduate Research Assistant and Laboratory Tutor.

An active science communicator, she has emceed national scientific events and holds leadership roles in postgraduate councils. Her accolades include Best Poster Presenter at the Graduate Research Symposium 2024.

advisoryGroupPartSecond.name: Dr. Sunita
advisoryGroupPartSecond.designation: Global Advocate for Sustainable Innovation in Public Health
advisoryGroupPartSecond.bio: Dr. Sunita Vidyarthi brings a unique blend of expertise in renewable energy, STEM innovation, and public health leadership. With a PhD in Solar Energy and international recognition in sustainable development, she has played a pivotal role in national STEM infrastructure (I-STEM, IISc Bengaluru) and public health outreach during crisis scenarios. Her work bridges technology and community well-being, shaping the future of sustainable development and health communication in India and beyond.
